New Records: Lautaro Martínez is the tournament’s top scorer with nine goals since his debut in the 2019 CONMEBOL Copa América.
Argentina has won their first three matches of a CONMEBOL Copa América tournament on 18 occasions, but this is only the third time they’ve done so in their last 12 participations (2007 and 2016).
Argentina averaged 74% possession against Peru, matching their second-highest possession rate in the CONMEBOL Copa América since at least the 2011 edition.

Argentina concluded their participation in the group stage of the 2024 CONMEBOL Copa América with three wins in three matches, without conceding any goals while scoring all their goals after half-time.
Lautaro Martínez finished the group stage as the Argentine player with the most shots (9) and the most goals (four out of Argentina’s five).
Argentina recorded their 13th victory against Peru in the CONMEBOL Copa América in 18 meetings (2 draws, 3 losses). This was the fifth time that the Albiceleste kept a clean sheet.
Out of the last 16 penalties taken against Peru in the CONMEBOL Copa América (including shootouts), seven were not converted (44%).
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored twice to help Argentina secure a 2-0 victory over Peru.
Leandro Paredes missed a penalty, hitting the inside of the post.
Pedro Gallese made a crucial save to stop Paredes’ free-kick from heading into the top-left corner.
Ángel Di María assisted Martínez’s first goal with a deft chip over Gallese.
Nicolás Tagliafico’s goal was disallowed due to an offside position.
Franco Zanelatto’s header hit the post in the dying moments of the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina had already secured a place in the quarter-finals before the match.
Lionel Messi was out due to a groin injury, and manager Lionel Scaloni was serving a touchline ban.
Post-Match Reflections: Lautaro Martínez has stepped up in the tournament, scoring in all three of Argentina’s group games and leading the race for the Golden Boot with four goals.
This is the first time Peru has been eliminated from the Copa America without a single victory since 1995.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami.
Argentina will face the runner-up of Group B in their quarter-final.
Canada took second place in Group A after their 0-0 draw with Chile.
